column4: set up IP for both computers... (I am really bad at this so be patient)
use network manager in the panel. click edit connections. Click wired. click your connection then cick Edit. Set the interface to static
you are in the ubuntu support channel..
then set the IP to siomething like 10.0.0.10 with netmask of 255.255.255.0
in Windows set the IP to 10.0.0.20 and netmask 255.255.255.0
static? I cant find a label with that...
in the drop down, it will be DHCP, change it to Manual
there isn't one, that's only for web access. You can put 10.0.0.1 if you want. Doesn't do anything
you may need to leave it blank if it doesn't work
actually leave it blank, less confusion
how do I know if they can find each other over the cable and not the wireless(I have that too)
thank you for the help "connection established" fivestars rate ;)
